perturbation.original_text: 1.1  "Customer" means a person or entity that has acquired, or has indicated its      interest in acquiring from Licensee, or from a Redistributor if so      specified herein, a non-exclusive and nontransferable Sublicense to use one      (1) or more of the Licensed Products.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1  "Customer" means a person or entity that has acquired, or has indicated its      interest in acquiring from Licensee, or from a Redistributor if so      specified herein, an exclusive and transferable Sublicense to use one      (1) or more of the Licensed Products.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Customer' states they receive a 'non-exclusive and nontransferable Sublicense'. The modified version changes this to 'exclusive and transferable Sublicense'. This directly contradicts the initial definition, creating confusion about the scope of rights granted to the Customer and whether they can transfer it or if they have exclusivity to it.

perturbation.original_text: Section 7.9    MODIFICATIONS.  Licensee shall not make any modifications to or derivations of the Licensed Products without the prior written consent of Licensor, except in the case of an Emergency Fix.  Licensee shall not reverse engineer or otherwise attempt to reproduce the source code of any Licensed Product.  In the event that Licensee makes any modification, alteration or enhancement to the Licensed Product or Documentation (including but not limited to an Emergency Fix), such modification, alteration or enhancement, including all intellectual property rights thereto, will be and remain the sole and exclusive property of Licensor.  Any suggestions or changes desired by Licensee to the Licensed Product or Documentation shall be made by
perturbation.changed_text: Section 7.9    MODIFICATIONS.  Licensee shall not make any modifications to or derivations of the Licensed Products without the prior written consent of Licensor, except in the case of an Emergency Fix.  Licensee shall not reverse engineer or otherwise attempt to reproduce the source code of any Licensed Product.  In the event that Licensee makes any modification, alteration or enhancement to the Licensed Product or Documentation (including but not limited to an Emergency Fix), such modification, alteration or enhancement, including all intellectual property rights thereto, will be and remain the property of licensee. Any suggestions or changes desired by Licensee to the Licensed Product or Documentation shall be made by
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that any modifications made by the licensee will be exclusive property of the licensor. This modified text indicates that any modifications to the Licensed product or Documentation will be property of licensee, creating a contradiction about the Intellectual property

perturbation.original_text: Section 14.1   TERM.  This Agreement shall be effective until the earlier of (a) its termination in accordance with the provisions of this Article 14 or (b) the date that is two (2) years after the date of this Agreement; provided, however, that this Agreement will renew automatically for successive terms of one (1) year each unless a party to this Agreement delivers written notice of termination to the other party to this Agreement at least sixty (60) days prior to the end of the original or any renewal term or the parties to this Agreement do not agree in writing to the Quota Amount referred to in subsection 14.2(b)(1) for any one (1) year renewal term at least sixty (60) days prior to the commencement of such term.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 14.1   TERM.  This Agreement shall be effective until the earlier of (a) its termination in accordance with the provisions of this Article 14 or (b) the date that is two (2) years after the date of this Agreement; provided, however, that this Agreement will renew automatically for successive terms of one (1) year each regardless if a party to this Agreement delivers written notice of termination to the other party to this Agreement at least sixty (60) days prior to the end of the original or any renewal term or the parties to this Agreement do not agree in writing to the Quota Amount referred to in subsection 14.2(b)(1) for any one (1) year renewal term at least sixty (60) days prior to the commencement of such term.
perturbation.explanation: This change directly contradicts the original text. The original text stated that the agreement would auto-renew unless a termination notice was sent at least 60 days prior. The modified text says it will auto-renew regardless if a termination notice was sent. This contradicts when and how the contract terminates and creates uncertainty.
